translation: wzdrygać się przed czymś, zapierać się [to be unwilling to do something or become involved in something because it is difficult, dangerous, etc.]
sentence: Many parents may balk at the idea of paying $100 for a pair of shoes.
He's a diminutive figure, less than five feet tall.

translation: rynna [a long, open pipe that is fixed to the edge of a roof to carry water away]
sentence: Every fall we have to clean leaves out of the gutters.

translation: nieustępliwy, bezkompromisowy [formal disapproving; (of people) unwilling to change their opinions or behavior in a way that would be helpful to others]
sentence: Unions claim that the management continues to maintain an intransigent position.

translation: wisiorek [a piece of jewellery worn around the neck, consisting of a long chain with an object hanging from it, or the object itself]
sentence: She was wearing a crystal pendant.

translation: wonny, przypominający coś zapachem [literary; smelling strongly of something or having qualities (especially smells) that make you think of something else]
sentence: The mountain air was redolent with the scent of pine needles.

translation: wartownik, strażnik [a soldier who guards a place, usually by standing at its entrance]
sentence: People approaching the gate were challenged by the sentry.

translation: kutas, frędzel [a group of short threads or ropes held together at one end, used as a hanging decoration on hats, curtains, furniture, etc.]
sentence: A tassel of silk or satin ribbons hangs from the handle.

translation: zmysłowa, ponętna; lubieżny [(formal) (of a woman) attractive in a sexual way with large breasts and hips; (literary) giving you physical pleasure]
sentence: She was very pretty and voluptuous.

translation: cudowny, zdumiewający [literary; extremely and surprisingly good; strange, beautiful, and impressive]
sentence: Our new improved moisturizer has wondrous effects on tired-looking skin.
